content.description: Tricky moves down low on the steep slab before it mellows out towards the top
content.location: Around the corner from Butt Crack on the west face

content.description: Left Face climbs the left side of the slabby face on the south face of Butt Rock.  Start on easier ground and work your way up along the left side of rock.  Fun route for beginner climbers as the rock is not steep, holds are there, but good friction footwork is required.
content.protection: This route is normally toproped as there are currently no bolts on the route. Very long slings are required for setting up the anchors.

content.location: First small chimney to the right of Butt Crack. ~10 feet right of West Buttress

content.description: Center Face sits on the south facing slabby wall and starts at the bottom, center section of rock, just left of a tree.  Thin face moves up and right gain you to steeper rock where there is one bolt.  Move up and right past bolt to easier climbing to the top.  Fun climbing for the moderate level climber and variations to the left can increase the difficulty by a grade or so.
content.protection: Although this south face would make excellent moderate leads, there is only one bolt midway up.  If you are tempted to lead this, be careful as this bolt is a teaser and you may find yourself quickly high off the ground, with no gear, and a few scary down climbing moves to get off.  Believe me...  Bring long slings to set up a proper toprope.

content.description: Low angled chimney. Bring long slings to set up top rope by slinging boulder at the top.
